author: ä¸¥èŒ‚å¼º
title: New-generation trainer aircraft made by China takes flight
text:
AG100, a new-generation trainer aircraft made by Aviation Industry Corp of China, began to be delivered to users on Friday.
At a delivery ceremony at AG100's manufacturing complex in Deqing, Zhejiang province, six AG100s were delivered to representatives from two buyersï¼Henan New Silk Road Flight College and Zhuhai AVIC Flight School.
In the next several weeks, these planes will undergo necessary checks and are scheduled to enter formal operation in March, according to project managers.
Built by the Zhejiang China Aviation Industry General Aircraft Institute, a subsidiary of AVIC General Aircraft, the AG100 is a model of a light-weight basic training plane for civilian flight students.
The three-seat plane is mainly made with low-cost composite materials and uses gasoline as fuel.
The aircraft features advanced technologies, good operational economy, easy maintenance and high safety, which makes it fit to be flown by entry-level aviators, according to its designers.
The research and development of AG100 started in April 2017. The type conducted its maiden flight in June 2020 and has since then flown hundreds of hours to test its capability and reliability.
In November 2023, the Civil Aviation Administration of China issued the type certificate to AG100. At the end of last year, the administration gave a production certificate to the plane, permitting the large-scale manufacturing.
According to specifications published by AVIC, the training plane is 7.26 meters long with a wingspan of 10.42 meters. It has a maximum takeoff weight of 975 kilograms, a flight ceiling of 4.3 kilometers, and can carry one trainer and two students.
The type has a cruising speed of 257 km per hour and a top flight range of 1,000 km.

organizations.name: henan new silk road flight college

author: Mariana Pacheco Ortiz
title: Reportan amenazas en Sisal tras tala ilegal; denuncian proyecto inmobiliario
text:
HunucmÃ¡, YucatÃ¡n.- Desde el pasado mes de febrero Sisal, que ostenta la denominaciÃ³n de Pueblo MÃ¡gico de YucatÃ¡n, ha sufrido la tala ilegal de manglar, vital para el ecosistema de la zona y aunque se tuvo la intervenciÃ³n de las fuerzas armadas en marzo para detener la devastaciÃ³n, esta ha continuado.
Ahora, vecinos del lugar sostienen que un proyecto inmobiliario estarÃ­a detrÃ¡s y denuncian amenazas por parte de los pobladores quiene estarÃ­an prestÃ¡ndose para arrasar de manera indiscriminada con la vegetaciÃ³n del lugar, donde segÃºn un boletÃ­n de la propia Procuraduria Federal de Proteccion al Ambiente (Profepa) ya se destruyeron al menos de 23,000 mÂ² de manglar botoncillo en zona federal, en la PenÃ­nsula de YucatÃ¡n.
PARA ENTENDER MEJOR: Tala ilegal en Sisal, el pueblo mÃ¡gico de YucatÃ¡n se queda sin mangle
Fue la maÃ±ana de este miÃ©rcoles 7 de mayo cuando un grupo de personas propietarias de viviendas este puerto que emerge en el Golfo de MÃ©xico y es comisarÃ­a de HunucmÃ¡, acudiÃ³ al Palacio de Gobierno en MÃ©rida, para solicitar la intervenciÃ³n de las autoridades y evitar que continÃºe el daÃ±o en esta zona.
Reportan amenazas en Sisal tras tala ilegal de mangle: denuncian proyecto inmobiliario
â€œNosotros consumimos en Sisal y contratamos a personas que nos cuiden las casas, hemos tenido una relaciÃ³n de paz y tranquilidadâ€.
â€œNo sabemos quÃ© inmobiliarias estÃ©n pagando, pero nosotro no somos los que tenemos los millones para decir esta parte noâ€¦ que sÃ­ hay mucha playa, sÃ­, porque el mar despuÃ©s de un huracÃ¡n muy grande se alejÃ³â€, afirma una de las manifestantes en la entrada del edificio que se localiza sobre la calle 61 esquina con calle 60 en el Centro HistÃ³rico de MÃ©ridaâ€.
Afectados en Sisal denuncian amenazas y agresiones
Y agrega que no pueden guardar silencio ante las agresiones al medio ambiente y hacia las familias que se oponen, pues â€œes una tristeza, estan tirando palmeras, devastando absolutamente todoâ€, se le escucha decir en un vÃ­deo que circula en redes sociales.
TE SUGERIMOS LEER: Crisis del queso de bola en YucatÃ¡n: por quÃ© y precio. Â¿AdiÃ³s a las marquesitas?
â€œNosotros estamos en las casas 3 o 4 personas y ellos se acercan con 50 personas a amenazar, es intimidante, peligroso, pero no podemos alejarnos porque es injusto lo que estÃ¡ psando en el puerto, quÃ© pena que estÃ©n azuzando a los sisaleÃ±os, porque nosostros hemos convivido por aÃ±os con ellosâ€, apunta una de las afectadas con una propiedad en Sisal.
â€œNosotros no estamos peleando terreno, nosotros estamos tranquilos en nuestras casas y ellos estÃ¡n viniendo a agredirnos, a quitarnosâ€¦ ellos que saben que es importante cuidar el medio ambiente estÃ¡n destruyÃ©ndoloâ€œ, aÃ±ade.
Barbarie en Sisal. DestrucciÃ³n de la vegetaciÃ³n y amenazas al estilo de la delincuencia organizada. Con justificaciones de todo tipo invaden y destruyen.
â€” Infolliteras (@infolliteras)[#YucatÃ¡n]va camino de ser otro Quintana Roo[pic.twitter.com/vGP8R1fKbD][May 7, 2025]
Otra de las personas que acudieron a manifestarse por la tala ilegal en Sisal, YucatÃ¡n, confirmÃ³ que â€œestÃ¡n llegando de una forma muy agresiva, estÃ¡n amenazando, estÃ¡n atacando, tienen ahÃ­ sus machetes, que eso fue lo que ocurriÃ³ en las Ãºltimas horas, ya hubieron agresiones fÃ­sicas y por eso estamos aquÃ­â€.
SeÃ±alan que las personas que se manifestaron son un grupo de personas que tienen viviendas en Sisal desde hace 30 o 40 aÃ±os en el puerto y conviven con los pobladores.
Con tono irÃ³nico algunos dicen que Sisal es pueblo mÃ¡gico, porque por arte de magia estÃ¡ desapareciendo el mangle, flora y fauna endÃ©mica a plena luz del dÃ­a y sin que nadie haga nada.
Ya que, a pesar de la gravedad del daÃ±o ambiental y de tratarse de un ecosistema protegido, hasta ahora ninguna autoridad se ha presentado en el lugar para evitar que el ecocidio continÃºe.
Â¿QuÃ© piden los manifestantes?
Solicitan la intervenciÃ³n de las autoridades para frenar la tala ilegal, asÃ­ como seguridad y garantÃ­as para las personas que denuncian la devastaciÃ³n al medio ambiente.
Â¿QuÃ© dice el gobierno de YucatÃ¡n al respecto?
Por su parte, durante su conferencia matutina de este miÃ©rcoles 7 de mayo, el gobernador de YucatÃ¡n, JoaquÃ­n DÃ­az Mena solicitÃ³ a la FiscalÃ­a General del Estado (FGE) YucatÃ¡n investigar la situaciÃ³n ocurrida en Sisal por la tala ilegal del manglar, en una zona de playa, pues ha continuado de forma indiscriminada a pesar de que desde marzo la Profepa clausurÃ³ la zona.
Destruyen manglar en Sisal, YucatÃ¡n, Pueblo MÃ¡gico: por arte de magia desaparece la vegetaciÃ³n y nadie hace nada
â€” Maror (@MarPachecoOrtiz)[pic.twitter.com/AETazGQJvX][May 7, 2025]
Â¿CuÃ¡l es la flora y fauna de Sisal?
Se puede encontrar en la zona especies vegetales adaptadas a la salinidad y los cambios de arena, como el bejuco de playa, palmas, uvas de mar, y palmeras de coco.
En cuanto a la fauna, se pueden observar aves acuÃ¡ticas migratorias, flamencos en ciertas Ã©poca del aÃ±o, reptiles como iguanas y tortugas, mamÃ­feros como zorrillos y comadrejas, entre otros.
HISTORIA RELACIONADA: Tala de mangle en Sisal, YucatÃ¡n: Profepa denuncia ante la FGR

title: Bad Bunny serÃ¡ presentador en los premios Oscar 2024 | Noticias de MÃ©xico | El Imparcial
text: Bad Bunny serÃ¡ presentador en los premios Oscar 2024 La entrega de los Premios Oscar 2024 serÃ¡ el 10 de marzo en el Dolby Theatre de Los Ãngeles. Ciudad de MÃ©xico.- A tan solo 10 dÃ­as de que se realice la ceremonia de los Premios Oscar, la Academia de Artes y Ciencias CinematogrÃ¡ficas confirmÃ³ que [Bad Bunny](https://www.elimparcial.com/tags/bad-bunny/) serÃ¡ uno de los presentadores. Por medio de las redes sociales de la Academia, se revelaron los nombres de las personalidades que formarÃ¡n parte de la gala que se realizarÃ¡ el 10 de marzo en el Dolby Theatre de Los Ãngeles. De esta forma, el nombre del Conejo Malo destacÃ³ en la segunda lista de presentadores por ser una estrella latina del reguetÃ³n. Te puede interesar: [Â¿CuÃ¡l ha sido uno de los errores mÃ¡s histÃ³ricos de los Premios Oscar?](https://www.elimparcial.com/locurioso/2024/02/28/cual-ha-sido-uno-de-los-errores-mas-historicos-de-los-premios-oscar/) Otros confirmados AdemÃ¡s del â€˜Conejo Maloâ€™, otros presentadores que fueron confirmados en el mismo anuncio son Dwayne Johnson, Michael Keaton, Chris Hemsworth, Jennifer Lawrence, Rita Moreno, John Mulaney, Catherine Oâ€™ Hara, Octavia Spencer y Ramy Youssef. Meet your second slate of presenters for the 96th Oscars.â€” The Academy (@TheAcademy) Tune into ABC to watch the Oscars LIVE on Sunday, March 10th at a new time, 7e/4p! [#Oscars] [pic.twitter.com/aRogLVYemh] [February 29, 2024] A pesar de que esta distinciÃ³n en la carrera de Bad Bunny pudiera sorprender, cabe mencionar que el intÃ©rprete de â€˜Ojitos lindosâ€™ recientemente ha participado en diversas pelÃ­culas no sÃ³lo con su mÃºsica, sino tambiÃ©n como actor, como lo fue â€˜Cassandroâ€™ (2023), protagonizada por Gael GarcÃ­a Bernal, o â€˜Tren balaâ€™ (2022) donde compartiÃ³ crÃ©ditos y pantalla con el ganador del Oscar Brad Pitt.

author: Chloe McPolin
title: 'I used to be able to sell out the restaurant three times a night. Now, there's probably two tables a week aft
text:
â€˜I used to be able to sell out the restaurant three times a night. Now, thereâ€™s probably two tables a week after 9pmâ€™ â€“ chef Oliver Dunne on restaurant closure
A chef and restaurateur has blamed the cost-of-living crisis for a noticeable slowdown in the number of people eating out in Dublin.
Earlier this week, Oliver Dunne announced the impending closure of Cleaver East in Temple Bar after 12 years in business.

author: Bernd-Dieter Herold
title: Paralympics-Starterin Lindy Ave fÃ¼hrt MV-Quartett zu den Deutschen Meisterschaften
text:
Para-Sport
Paralympics-Starterin Lindy Ave fÃ¼hrt MV-Quartett zu den Meisterschaften
Rostock / Lesedauer: 1 min
Der Verband fÃ¼r Behinderten- und Rehabilitationssport Mecklenburg-Vorpommerns ist bei den Deutschen Meisterschaften in der Para-Leichtathletik mit vier Sportlern vertreten. Die TitelkÃ¤mpfe werden am Wochenende ausgetragen.
Das Quartett wird durch die Neubrandenburgerin Lindy Ave angefÃ¼hrt. Die 27-JÃ¤hrige vom Verein Leichtathletik inklusiv Greifswald hatte im vergangenem Jahr bei den Paralympics in Paris Ã¼ber 400 Meter die Bronzemedaille und zuvor bei der WM in Kobe (Japan) Silber geholt. FÃ¼r Ave ist Leichlingen die letzte MÃ¶glichkeit, sich fÃ¼r die Para-Weltmeisterschaften Ende September in Neu-Delhi (Indien) zu qualifizieren. Ave hat fÃ¼r die 100 Meter (Norm 12,72 Sekunden) und 400 Meter (1:00:88 Minuten) gemeldet. Bisher haben 13 Para-Leichtathleten die Qualifikationsvorgaben erfÃ¼llt.
Vom 1. LAV Rostock werden Hanna Wiechmann, Christoph Cords und Andreas GrÃ¶bner an den Start gehen. Mit Spannung wird das Auftreten von Christoph Cords erwartet. Bei den Para Games Ende April in Rostock hatte der 45-JÃ¤hrige in seiner Behindertenklasse mit 7,04 Meter einen Deutschen Rekord aufgestellt. Einen Monat spÃ¤ter verbesserte er die Marke bei den Halleschen Werfertagen auf 7,95 Meter.

author: Catherine Hickley
title: Hartwig Fischer, former British Museum director, is appointed to run Saudi museum of world cultures
text: Hartwig Fischer, the former director of the British Museum who resigned last year after a devastating [theft scandal](/keywords/british-museum-thefts), has been appointed as the founding director of a new museum of world cultures in Riyadh, according to a statement from the Saudi Museums Commission. The museum is due to open in 2026. Fischer will â€œset the foundations for the museum and lead it, based on his global expertise in leading international cultural institutions and museums,â€ the Saudi Museums Commission said. It did not specify when he will take up the post. The new museum, currently under construction, is to be housed in a 110m-high building designed by the Spanish architect Ricardo Bofill, located in the Royal Arts Complex in King Salman Park, the statement said. It will â€œexhibit Saudi and Arabian Peninsula heritage and highlight the cultures that have emerged and expanded over time from Africa across Asia, Europe, Oceania and the Americas,â€ the release continued, describing it as â€œa pivotal moment in Saudi Arabiaâ€™s cultural renaissanceâ€. Fischer left the British Museum in August 2023, a year earlier than expected, after the discovery that hundreds of items had been stolen from the museumâ€™s Greek and Roman department over a number of years. The museum fired several staff members and has opened legal proceedings against a [former curator](/2024/05/28/weve-got-our-man-says-british-museum-chair-as-bbc-programme-digs-deep-into-thefts). The curatorâ€™s son has denied that his father was involved in the theft. In announcing his resignation, Fischer said â€œit is evident that the British Museum did not respond as comprehensively as it should have in response to the warnings in 2021,â€ adding that â€œthe responsibility for that failure must ultimately rest with the directorâ€.

author: PTI
title: 2024 becomes warmest year on record, first to breach 1.5-degree Celsius guardrail
text:
New Delhi: The year 2024 was the hottest year on record, and the first with a global average temperature 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, European climate agency Copernicus confirmed on Friday.

.

Every month from January to June 2024 was the warmest ever recorded for those months. From July to December, except for August, each month was the second warmest on record, behind 2023, it said.

.

According to scientists at the Copernicus Climate Change Service (C3S), 2024 was the hottest year since global temperature tracking began in 1850.

.

The average global temperature was 15.1 degrees Celsius -- 0.72 degrees above the 1991-2020 average and 0.12 degrees higher than that in 2023, the previous record-holder.

.

Scientists noted that the average temperature in 2024 was 1.60 degrees Celsius above the 1850-1900 baseline, the period before human activities like burning fossil fuels began significantly impacting the climate.

.

This is the first time the average global temperature has remained 1.5 degrees Celsius above the 1850-1900 average for an entire calendar year.

.

However, a permanent breach of the 1.5-degree Celsius limit specified in the Paris Agreement refers to long-term warming over a 20- or 30-year period.

.

That said, experts feel that the world is now entering a phase where temperatures will be consistently above this threshold.

.2024 on track to be hottest year on record: World Meteorological Organisation.

Harjeet Singh, climate activist and the founding director of Satat Sampada Climate Foundation, said the world is entering a new climate reality -- one where extreme heatwaves, devastating floods, and intense storms will become increasingly frequent and severe.

.

"To prepare for this future, we must urgently scale up adaptation efforts across every level of society -- redesigning our homes, cities, and infrastructure, and transforming how we manage water, food, and energy systems," he said.

.

Singh said the world must move from fossil fuels to clean energy quickly and fairly, making sure no one is left behind, and that rich countries have a bigger responsibility to take bold steps.

.

C3S scientists said that in 2024, greenhouse gas levels in the atmosphere hit their highest annual levels ever recorded. Carbon dioxide levels were 2.9 parts per million (ppm) higher than in 2023, reaching 422 ppm, while methane levels rose by 3 parts per billion (ppb), reaching 1897 ppb.

.

Sea ice extent in the Arctic and around Antarctica, which is an essential indicator of the stability of Earth's climate, reached "record or near-record low values" for the second year in a row.

.

The year 2024 will also be remembered as the year developed nations had their last big chance to prevent the world from permanently crossing the 1.5 degrees Celsius threshold by funding climate action in the Global South, but that didn't seem to materialise.

.

Relentless warming fuelled record-breaking heatwaves, deadly storms, and floods that devastated lives and homes by the thousands in 2024. Millions were displaced, and all eyes turned to the UN climate conference in Baku, Azerbaijan, hoping for a climate finance package capable of ramping up action in the Global South.

.

A study published in 2023 estimated that developed countries owe around $170 trillion for their excessive emissions, having consumed 70â€“90 per cent of the total carbon budget since the industrial era.

.

Instead, developed countries -- mandated under the UN climate regime to finance climate action in developing countries -- offered a paltry $300 billion by 2035, a mere fraction of the trillions needed annually from 2025.

.

While political will remains fragmented, science continues to remind the world that it's an emergency.

.

In 2015, countries came together to limit global warming to "well below 2 degrees Celsius", aiming for 1.5 degrees Celsius. Fast forward, the world has already heated up by 1.3 degrees Celsius since the pre-industrial era, largely due to burning fossil fuels.

.

To limit warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius, the UN's climate science body, IPCC, says emissions must peak by 2025 and drop 43 per cent by 2030 and 57 per cent by 2035.

.

Yet, current policies point to a hotter future -- around 3 degrees Celsius warming by 2100. Even if every country fulfils its climate promises or Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), emissions will only shrink by a weak 5.9 per cent by 2030, far below what's needed.

.
